title: Canaccord Genuity sued over film scheme losses
text:
A top City firm has been dragged into a long-running row over a tax avoidance scheme linked to celebrities such as David Beckham.

Canaccord Genuity Financial Planning is battling a £10m lawsuit over claims it wrongly encouraged wealthy clients to pump their cash into notorious film investment programmes such as those run by Ingenious Media, which were used to dodge taxes.

Former customer Peter Breitenbach and other ex-clients claim the firm did not do enough to warn them they might not get promised tax benefits, after a HMRC crackdown which slapped users with huge bills.
